intro: Aethusa divaricata, commonly known as the cow parsley or wild chervil, is a biennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Aethusa divaricata is also known for its mild, aromatic scent and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
